intro: Myrobalanus glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth tamarind, is a deciduous tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and elongated, leathery leaves. The tree produces small, fragrant flowers followed by woody pods containing edible, acidic seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and riverine habitats. The plant has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties and as a source of tannins.
